alert.note: Alert for Christian (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 01 at 7:51AM CDT until June 04 at 11:54AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CDT TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Barry, Christian, Dade, Greene, Jasper, Lawrence, Newton, Stone and Taney. * WHEN...Until noon CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 751 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Sac River at County Road 1247, Flat Creek at Highway U, Wilson`s Creek at Old Limey Road, Shoal Creek at Farm Road 2110 and Flat Creek at Highway C. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Western Springfield, Nixa, Republic, Branson, Monett, Aurora, Battlefield and Mount Vernon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
